results.title: Shrinkage
results.creator_credit: Nathan Boxer, Willard Goodman and Protective Films
results.brief_description: Shoplifting in a department store and how to deal with it. The methods used by shoplifters to distract attention and conceal stolen goods. Precautions to reduce the risk of stealing and the procedure for apprehending a person seen stealing.

results.title: Shrek [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Andrew Adamson, Vicky Jenson, Aron Warner, Jeffrey Katzenberg, John H. Williams and NBCUniversal
results.brief_description: Once upon a time in a land far, far away, and so begins this animated fantasy. Set in a fantastical kingdom inhabited by fairy tale creatures, the story finds the enchanted princess, Fiona (Cameron Diaz) locked away in a tower guarded by a dragon; a scheming Lord Farquaard (John Lithgow) who wants to marry the princess so he can become King; an unlikely hero, the lovable ogre Shrek (Mike Myers) and his sidekick, Donkey (Eddie Murphy), who are sent by Farquaard to rescue the princess and bring her back to be his bride. Children will enjoy the tale for what it is - a lively romp, while adults will enjoy the many intertextual references to numerous other fairy tales.

results.title: Health
results.creator_credit: Robin James, ABC-TV (Australia), Asian Studies Council and Griffith University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dragons tongue. - Series 2.”.
In this Chinese language program, Professor Colin Mackerras explores the many ways in which the Chinese people look after their health. Hospitals may be run by Government Departments for workers. Apart from conventional medicine, traditional therapies such as Acupuncture and Moxibustion are widely accepted. Herbal remedies are also important to Chinese medicine and many pharmacies carry both manufactured drugs and herbal treatments. This program also looks at the composition of a character when practising calligraphy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robin James, ABC-TV (Australia), Asian Studies Council and Griffith University

results.title: Families
results.creator_credit: Robin James, ABC-TV (Australia), Asian Studies Council and Griffith University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dragons tongue. - Series 2.”.
In this Chinese language program, Professor Colin Mackerras looks at the importance of family in Chinese culture, especially since the law restricted family size to one child in order to contain the population. Chinese Law since the 1950’s forbade polygamy and arranged marriages, and now young people can choose their own partners. The status of women and girls is discussed and the problems encountered raising single children. The program also looks at oracle bones and how these lead to the creation of written language.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robin James, ABC-TV (Australia), Asian Studies Council and Griffith University

results.title: The Little world of Dietmar Fill
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, Don Murray, John Shaw and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The late Dietmar Fill has been accorded many honours for his remarkable natural science films and his micro-photography. This series draws together the best of his work, giving us an insight into his film-making techniques and letting us meet the man.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Greg Reading, Don Murray, John Shaw and Film Australia

results.title: Showbiz ballyhoo
results.creator_credit: Gail Gibson Sedawie, Norman Sedawie, Richard Gabourie Productions and T A D Productions
results.brief_description: This documentary examines the machinations and power of the Hollywood studio publicity departments of the 1930s and 40s, a time of the studios’ heyday, when the public had an unbridled fascination for the stars of the silver screen. On screen and off, fans were sold the notion of the dream, where glamour, money, fame and beauty were in endless supply. Movie newsreels, gossip columnists and press agents played a major role in presenting actors such as Errol Flynn, Clarke Gable and Vivien Leigh as eternally glamorous and gay, spending their lives at parties and opening night galas. Actors, celebrities and child stars were also used as a propaganda tool, sending messages that supported various causes, including war bonds, bills of government and political parties. Public appearances were as important as the films that the stars made, and actors were expected to tour on junkets around the country. Footage in the documentary includes clips from iconic Hollywood films, famous screen tests, bloopers and scenes from spectacular musical productions of the 1930s. Features footage of: Humphrey Bogart, Bette Davis, Joan Crawford, Bing Crosby, James Cagney, Shirley Temple, Mickey Rooney, Judy Garland, Ronald Reagan, Rita Hayworth, Tyrone Power and The Marx Brothers.

results.title: The Vision
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, Don Murray, John Shaw and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Little world of Dietmar Fill”.
This video concentrates on the alpine flora and fauna but also discusses Dietmar’s vision of the natural world. It focuses in the corroboree frog and again, the photography is excellent. Narrated by Robyn Williams.

results.title: The Survivor
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, Don Murray, John Shaw and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Little world of Dietmar Fill”.
At Dampier on the north west coast of Western Australia, a tidal creek has been dammed off from the sea to produce salt from seawater. Dietmar Fill puts the salt-ponds under the microscope in this study of how life responds to this increasingly stressful saline environment. Included is a general description of the Pilbara area and its former inhabitants, the salt lagoons and its mining.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Greg Reading, Don Murray, John Shaw and Film Australia

results.title: Estuary
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, Don Murray, John Shaw and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Little world of Dietmar Fill”.
Features the plants (mangroves) and animals living in a tidal estuary at Port Stevens, Sydney. Discusses the habitat problems of tidal movement and salinity in fresh water. Narrated by Robin Williams.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Greg Reading, Don Murray, John Shaw and Film Australia

results.title: Shore
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, Don Murray, John Shaw and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Little world of Dietmar Fill”.
Where the sea meets the land we find a place of harsh extremes and constant change. Dietmar, Bibi and marine biologist Elizabeth Pope, explore the rich and varied life of the rocky seashore. Narrated by Robyn Williams.
